alert.note: Alert for Baker; Northern Columbia; Southern Columbia; Union (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 7:24PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Baker, Union and east central Columbia Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 723 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout near Olustee, or 16 miles east of Lake City, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, winds around 40 mph, and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lake Butler, Raiford, Macclenny, Glen St. Mary, Palestine Community, Lulu, Olustee, Sanderson, Ellerbee and Johnstown. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Jacksonville.

area.areaDesc: Baker; Northern Columbia; Southern Columbia; Union
